item.title: Enabling Low-Code Developers to Create Custom Client Reports with a Helping Hand from Azure â€“ Norfolk Power Platform User Group
item.description:
Enabling Low-Code Developers to Create Custom Client Reports with a Helping Hand from Azure â€“ Norfolk Power Platform User Group

ğŸ“… Date: 22nd May 2025
ğŸ“ Location: Norwich Digital Hub
ğŸ• Pizza included!

Session Overview

At the Norfolk Power Platform User Group, I delivered a session titled:

âœ¨ â€œEnabling low-code developers to create custom client reports with a helping hand from Azureâ€

In this session, I explored:

  • Using Power Automate to generate custom reports securely.
  • How to leverage an Azure Function as a reverse proxy to enhance security and scalability.
  • An architectural pattern that integrates Dataverse, Power Automate, SharePoint, and Azure Functions to deliver dynamic, client-ready PDFs via secure links.

item.title: Avoid Costly Mistakes: Backing Up Your Power Platform Development Environment
item.description:
What Would Happen If You Lost Your Dev Environment?

Ever wondered what would happen if someone accidentally deleted your development site or overwrote a key flow? Rebuilding from memory isn’t just frustrating â€” itâ€™s costly.

This post walks through the process I demonstrated during my session with the Power Platform Learner to Leader community, showing how to automatically back up your environment using Azure DevOps, without requiring advanced YAML knowledge.
